comments.message:
To the management of McDonalds. I am seriously very pissed off with one of your cashier Auntie at the Safra Yishun outlet. My mum went to takeaway breakfast for us and first, the order was wrong even though my mum showed her The order that I SMSed to her phone. I typed one egg Mcmuffin meal with hot Milo and one Ham breakfast wrap with iced Milo. And Guess what? The Aunty didn't bother to read at all. What we got was 2 egg mcmuffin meal both with hot Milo. WTF?! Where's my breakfast wrap and ice Milo? 
Secondly the auntie was very rude. She told my mum that for takeaways you have to pack by yourself. Seriously in all my years that I've ordered takeaways, it's always been the staff packing the order for us and not us packing the food by ourselves. The Auntie was not even friendly to begin with. In addition, she did not even ask if my mum is a Safra member (and my mum is!).
Honestly, if the Aunty was not happy to work today she can jolly well go home and take a break instead of providing such shitty service. 
I am seriously very unhappy and upset with the service I got today. U can check my order at McDonald's Yishun Safra Queue number 185. Please do something about the attitudes of your staff. I don't expect them to smile at every customer but at least provide a decent service.
Why the heck was I being charged 60 cents for the iced milo upgrade when I bought the breakfast deluxe?

This is bs! I was charged 60¢ when i purchase big breakfast at punggol cc and when i check with the staff, she told me 'yes it's free upgrade and looked at the receipt. Then changed her story to 'only for mushrooms breakfast platter', took my receipt n walked away! Leaving me standing there!
Err no more Grab & Go??

Joe Ngo

Hi, the manager at McDonald's Yew Tee at 1.30PM today informed me that I couldn't change the Quarter Pounder's ketchup to tartar sauce. I cancelled the order and left as a result of this frustration.

I go to McDonald's every week and this has always been ok. Please inform your Yew Tee manager to not be lazy. I see that the staff are moving slowly and if efficiency is an issue, the solution should be to train them to be faster instead of limiting options to your loyal customer.

Hello!!! I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the Manager and Staffs at the branch of Bendemeer Mac. I lost my car key yesterday during lunch. I went back to the restaurant today and talk to a manager (lady in black uniform) who is cleaning the glass door for help. She immediately stop her task and went back in to ask around and checked the office. She return with a clear plastic zip-lock bag which have my car key in it. I was overjoy and thankful that my car key is found and keep in a proper and safe condition. Thank you very much!!!

Ordered the deal for 2 and ended up being a hungry and angry person

I am a frequent customer at McDonald's and have been patronising the outlet at Yew Tee point.

I am glued to the current promotion of spicy nuggets. However, I have never got the chance to purchase it at the above mentioned outlet as it is always unavailable.

I have went 10 times at different timings and different days but ended up with disappointment every single time. Imagine the long queue especially during peak periods?

If the spicy nuggets are only available at selected outlets, shouldn't customers be informed? Or if they are all sold out, shouldn't the outlet do something to alert the customers?

Such a prominent fast food restaurant in Singapore, yet keep failing your faithful customer. 

Spicy nuggets only come once in a while so there ought to be sufficient stocks. Don't tell me it is unexpected for the overwhelming response as it is not the first time since the spicy nuggets are launched many years back.

It is very disappointing - I grow up with McDonald's but it just keeps failing me. Don't belittle all your food products. Every items have their supporters. I waited so long for the spicy nuggets and it is only available for a limited time, so naturally I will have more frustration. 

Pls replenish more stocks at Yew Tee Point. I will really appreciate that.

Thank You.
Angry bird customer.

comments.message:
Could be better if you use the chicken patty from Crispy Chicken Burger instead of McSpicy's...

The 'fiery pepper mayo' is a good combination with the egg but the chicken patty covers everything... =(

Hi McDonald's Team, I would like to highlight the most atrocious standards of customer service I recently received from the Upper Bukit Timah (Beauty World) branch of McDonald's.
I order McDonald's home delivery, on average, at least once a week, but this is the first time I am actually expending energy and time to write a complaint.
I placed a dinner order (#BWC-24/05/2016-96) for my family earlier this evening through the McDelivery app (email confirmation was received at 7.08pm). Estimated delivery time indicated on the app was 8.50pm.
At 9.14pm, my order had still not arrived. I phoned the McDonald's call centre to ask if they could kindly check on the delivery status. I was informed by Yvonne (call centre) that she would check with the Floor Manager of the Beauty World outlet. However, when I did not receive any reply by 9.25pm, I phoned the call centre once more, and this time, I spoke to a different male representative. The rep then asked the BW Floor Manager to phone me personally.
The McDonald's BW Floor Manager rang me at 9.31pm and introduced herself as Shanti. She promised to check with the specific rider assigned to our delivery, and to get back to me.
After 10 minutes, I rang her at 9.41pm. Shanti said their "system" indicated that my order had already been "delivered". Imagine that!! - for waiting over 2 and a half hours after my original order had been placed, only to be told that we had supposedly received our phantom order.
I told her that our family had had enough of waiting, and that we would come down to the Beauty World branch personally to collect our order. While we were getting changed to head over to BW, the intercom rang at about 9.45pm - with the rider announcing his arrival (at long last)!
When he arrived at our doorstep, we asked him what had caused such an overwrought delay in delivery - however, we soon realised that he spoke very little english and appeared genuinely befuddled and apologetic that there had been a delay of this extent (for what was now close to 3 hours and 45 minutes after our initial order time). He apologised profusely, and informed us that he had only just received the order awhile back.
We then phoned Shanti at 9.47pm to cancel the order pickup as the rider had arrived.
Suddenly overcome with a loss of appetite resulting from the long-overdue order, we checked the physical order receipt and saw that the time printed on it indicated 20:59 (8.59pm)!
We phoned Shanti once we saw this (at 9.51pm) as we had the right to know why our order was only prepared at 8.59pm when we had placed it almost 2 hours ago at 7.08pm (order preparation time was even after the indicated delivery time at 8.50pm)!
Shanti apologised but either could not/ or did not want to answer our questions, or even give us a reasonable explanation. We told her that we just wanted the honest truth, and would be willing to overlook it if the delay had been caused by some oversight on their end.
Instead, she pushed the blame to the rider, saying that he was new and could not speak english. Our patience was completely worn out by this stage, and we were hardly in the mood for lazy and/or insincere excuses - and told her that customers did not deserve to be treated with such dishonesty, and should be compensated for having to pay for such shoddy treatment.
Shanti then asked how we wanted her to make up for the error, and then proceeded to made a mockery of the entire fracas by saying she would send us a duplicate set of our order right away (talk about adding insult to injury).
I informed Shanti that her offer was offensive - we were not even in the mood to start on our delivered meal! I told her that we would much prefer our next order (up to an identical value) to be free, and that I would pay for any amount exceeding said value. There was much displeasure emanating from her end - however, the phone call ended on that (somewhat?) resolution.
Our burgers and fries may have arrived warm (thanks to the efficient rider - seeing how he only received the order at 8.59pm) - however, the only taste left in our memory was one of unpleasantness.
Nice and tasty!

Uncooked oily raw bacon just like ham... the rest is fine tho... we had a good laugh thinking he suay/unlucky... until all our meal share the same fate when our so called food came...

20th may...
Go late supper with my gf at 2am... thanks but no thanks... for spoiling our wonderful supper.. we order ur red burger set and dbl cheese burger set... AGAIN it gave me a devastating shock! The fries taste wierd and smelly, like sum1 use detergent to cook the fries (OMG) cant even finished it in 1st time of my life eating mac.. 2ndly, the supposedly juicy and tender beef of dbl cheese burger is DRY dry DRY and she got choked on... she gave up after 1/4 bites.. now 3rdly de RED burger. Bread OK. Spicy Chicken OK. Veg and Sauce OK.... the egg... did i mention i almost vomit? Seriously rotten taste of the egg!! It looked cooked but taste raw and rotten... the 1st bite send a chill down my spine... and my burger include free left over chao ta bacon bits and duno how many days eggs bits... cant bother to tell de staff because i know they cant bother about it... please... do sumthing to that outlets.. until then we wunt even dare patron there.

Start Afresh

Read: Psalm 86:5-15

His compassions never fail. They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness. —Lamentations 3:22-23

When I was growing up, one of my favorite books was Anne of Green Gables by Lucy Maud Montgomery. In one amusing passage, young Anne, by mistake, adds a skin medication instead of vanilla to the cake she is making. Afterward, she exclaims hopefully to her stern-faced guardian, Marilla, “Isn’t it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?”
I like that thought: tomorrow is a new day—a new day when we can start afresh. We all make mistakes. But when it comes to sin, God’s forgiveness is what enables us to start each morning with a clean slate. When we repent, He chooses to remember our sins no more (Jer. 31:34; Heb. 8:12).

Some of us have made wrong choices in our lives, but our past words and deeds need not define our future in God’s eyes. There is always a fresh start. When we ask for His forgiveness, we take a first step toward restoring our relationship with Him and with others. “If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness” 
(1 John 1:9).

God’s compassion and faithfulness are new every morning (Lam. 3:23), so we can start afresh each day. —
Cindy Hess Kasper

Lord JESUS...Thank You for this new day. 
Forgive me for doing those things in the past that I shouldn't have done, and for not doing those things that I should have done. 
Set my feet on Your right path today-Amen

Each new day gives us new reasons to praise the Lord JESUS-Amen

INSIGHT: 
Psalm 86:5 declares, “You, Lord, are forgiving and good.” The Hebrew word translated “forgiving” is sallah and literally means “ready to forgive.” 
Sallah appears just once in the Old Testament. 
By choosing this particular word, the psalmist is telling his readers that the Lord is not only capable of forgiving our sins, He is also ready and willing to do so-Amen
